#: on behalf of Cedric Beust :: 6/1/2005 12:45 AM :#
>> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On 
>> Behalf Of Robert Watkins
> 
>> > Yup, this would be a great improvement.  And while we're at it, have 
>> > JUnit not run any test in this class and subclasses when this happens.
>> 
>> JUnit can do this already. You just use a TestSetup decorator 
>> for the TestSuite, and then JUnit won't run the tests in the 
>> class, if that's a required feature for you.
> 
> JUnit can do anything, all you need to do is write the code.
> 

In fact the users can do anything... with an additional inspiration. At some point, i think we
should weight which are the good parts and which are the ones that require you to focus on how to
modify JUnit to fit your needs, instead of focusing on what you really have to test.

:alex |.::the_mindstorm::.|

> I'm talking about making this the default behavior of JUnit so that anybody
> who downloads junit.jar will see this behavior.
>
